Hi, my name is Andrew K and I'm presenting joint work done with Gary Wong, Carl Doersch and Eric Leonard Miller, and improving OCR performance.
Our paper presents a way to obtain document specific training data in an automatic way for use in optical character recognition.
We do this by first using an external OCR system to get an initial translation of the words in a document.
Our algorithm then selects a subset of these words to be used as document specific training data.
You can see an example of this subset of words that are algorithm fixed by the red boxes in this figure.
Of course it's not a new idea to use a portion of a translation as training data, but the novel contribution that we make is that training data generated in our way is virtually ever free.

We present theoretical justification that our algorithm is highly unlikely to include errors in training data and also empirical results showing that by using this document specific training data, we can significantly reduce errors from the initial OCR system.

Hi, my name is Andrew K and I'm presenting joint work done with Gary Wong, Carl Doersch and Eric Leonard Miller, and improving OCR performance.
Our paper presents a way to obtain document specific training data in an automatic way for use in optical character recognition.
We do this by first using an external OCR system to get an initial translation of the words in a document.
Our algorithm then selects a subset of these words to be used as document specific training data.
You can see an example of this subset of words that are algorithm fixed by the red boxes in this figure.
Of course it's not a new idea to use a portion of a translation as training data, but the novel contribution that we make is that training data generated in our way is virtually ever free.

We present theoretical justification that our algorithm is highly unlikely to include errors in training data and also empirical results showing that by using this document specific training data, we can significantly reduce errors from the initial OCR system.
